title: Bankrupt Cryptopia Exchange to Return Crypto to Some Creditors
description: The New Zealand exchange went offline in 2019 following a cyber attack that saw millions of dollars worth of tokens stolen.

title: US to Challenge Extradition of Terra Founder Do Kwon to South Korea
description: The jurisdictional tug-of-war between U.S. and South Korean prosecutors over Terra founder Do Kwon continues to drag on.

title: Telegram Game 'Notcoin' Launches Pre-Market Trading Ahead of Airdrop
description: Notcoin is letting top players trade mined coins via NFT vouchers before the airdrop—and is burning coins of inactive users, too.

title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
description:
Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

BlackRock, one of the largest asset managers in the world, is planning to buy spot Bitcoin (BTC) exchange-traded funds (ETFs) for its Global Allocation Fund (MALOX).

The updated filing notes that MALOX may purchase BlackRock’s own spot Bitcoin ETF, the iShares Bitcoin Trust (IBIT), as well as ETFs by other issuers, stating:

“The fund may acquire shares in ETPs that seek to reflect generally the performance of the price of Bitcoin by directly holding bitcoin — ‘Bitcoin ETPs’ — including shares of a Bitcoin ETP sponsored by an affiliate of BlackRock.”

Read more

description: The SEC, under Chair Gary Gensler, remains ambiguous on whether Ethereum should be classified as a security or commodity amid increasing attention on Ethereum ETFs.
